ğ’€­[[ğ’Š¬]] [[ğ’‚µ]]ğ’‰Œ ğ’ˆ—ğ’Œ·, *Shar-kali-Sharri king of [[all]] kings,

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Dilmun_%28early_Sumerian_pictograph%29.jpg/30px-Dilmun_%28early_Sumerian_pictograph%29.jpg)  
[[ğ’‰Œ]][[ğ’Œ‡]]ğ’†  ni.tuk.ki = DILMUN  ğ’‰Œğ’Œ‡ğ’†  á¹£al.mun salomon  
[[ğ’‰Œ]][[ğ’Œ‡]]ğ’†  ğ’Œ‡Del.ğ’‰ŒMan DILMUN checks out [ğ’‰Œğ’‰Œ](min)  dÊ°ÄÊ°emon @ PIE  
[[ğ’‰Œ]][[ğ’Œ‡]]ğ’†  DILMUN = moddern Dammam (Arabic: Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù…Ù‘Ø§Ù…) checks out  
[[ğ’‰Œ]][[ğ’Œ‡]]ğ’†  DILmun = TYLos (Bachrain under Greek) checks out  
[[ğ’‰Œ]][[ğ’Œ‡]]ğ’†  DILMUN â‡” Jemen, Oman, Amun

Dilmun was a central figure to the Sumerian creation myth, basically garden of Eden (Aden), drowned by 120m of rising sea levels.
